basic.description: This course examines struggles against racism and imperialism in post-colonial history, especially transnational solidarities and their expression in shared cultures of resistance by peoples of colour across the 'Third World' (and, later, the 'First World'). From 1955 to the present, this course charts the 'Spirit of Bandung' in revolutionary politics, culture and history.
basic.subject: HIST
basic.title: Global Post-Colonial History: Solidarities, Resistance and the Legacy of Bandung

extra.enrollment_requirement: PREREQUISITE    A Grade of C+ in 6.0 units from HIST 300-329 and registration in a HIST Major or Medial Plan.
